name: EIGRP
description: Enhanced Interior Gateway Routing Protocol (EIGRP) is Cisco's advanced distance vector routing protocol that uses the DUAL (Diffusing Update Algorithm) for loop-free routing and fast convergence.
key_topics: EIGRP metric calculation (bandwidth, delay, load, reliability, MTU)
EIGRP neighbor requirements (AS number, K-values, authentication)
EIGRP packets (Hello, Update, Query, Reply, ACK)
common_misconceptions: Training materials often call EIGRP a 'hybrid' protocol. Cisco documentation clarifies it's an advanced distance vector protocol, not a hybrid

Many resources incorrectly state EIGRP uses only bandwidth and delay by default. Cisco config guides show that while K1 (bandwidth) and K3 (delay) are enabled by default, understanding all K-values is important

Third-party books oversimplify feasible successors. Cisco's documentation explains that a route qualifies as a feasible successor only if its advertised distance is less than the current feasible distance
Common error: confusing administrative distance with EIGRP metric. AD (90) determines protocol preference; EIGRP's composite metric determines best path within EIGRP
